trustfund:
TF010264-South Sudan - Sector Plan Analysis,TF056452-SOUTHERN SUDAN EDUCATION
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Rehabilitation
            Project for South Sudan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Grantee performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: in hindsight, an in-depth
            discussion and the adoption of a common approach across
            Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF)- funded projects will have
            been beneficial, because many issues across projects or
            sectors were similar and related to state building and
            development of government systems, for example, the
            establishment of a civil service and ministry structures,
            and technical and fiduciary capacity building. Education
            Rehabilitation Project (ERP) will have benefit from a more
            rigorous assessment of project readiness for implementation,
            realism of its targets, and time frame. Building strong
            Monitoring and Evaluation (M and E) systems as integral part
            of project implementation from the start is essential It is
            vital to begin stakeholder dialogue early on and maintain it
            throughout preparation and implementation. This includes
            dialogue and regular communication with donors, but also
            beneficiaries and their communities. The project will have
            benefit from an even larger staff presence on the ground and
            intensified management guidance and support. State capacity
            building approach may slow down implementation initially,
            but will pay off in the medium to long term through enhanced
            ministry ownership and capacity.
